pages.title: Firebox
pages.text: The <item>Firebox/$ is the simplest way to produce heat by burning fuel. Any furnace fuel can be used to produce heat at a constant rate.$(br2)Fuels will burn for the same time as in a furnace, capped at 4000 ticks (enough for coal or a kelp block, less than a coal block;
config controlled).$(br2)It connects to a <item>$(l:crossroads:heat/cable)cable/$ on the top. <thing>$(l:essentials/circuits#reader)Reader circuits/$ measure the fullness of the input.$(br2)
